definition: (onom.) rustling sound/sound of rain or of sth falling down/in disorder/completely smashed/badly battered/broken to pieces

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
clamor/noise/(bound form) sound used to call cats
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat

sentences.english: You thanked her by throwing it through the next-door-neighbor's window.
sentences.chinese: 你报答她，把邻居的玻璃砸得稀里哗啦。

sentences.english: Roy:Apparently, getting your ass kicked is now a part of this complete breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 看起来，被打得稀里哗啦会是你整顿早饭的一部分了。

sentences.english: The boys crashed into the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩稀里哗啦地进入教室里。

sentences.english: The clump of bamboo outside the window was completely flattened by the raging winds.
sentences.chinese: 窗外的竹子被狂风吹得稀里哗啦，东倒西歪。

sentences.english: You thanked her by throwing it through the next-door-neighbor’s window.
sentences.chinese: 你报答她，把邻居的玻璃砸得稀里哗啦。

sentences.english: You thanked her by throwing it though the next-door-neighbor's window.
sentences.chinese: 你报答她，把邻居的玻璃窗砸的稀里哗啦。

sentences.english: Today, the city is also often hear that noise, "Song of the flea."
sentences.chinese: 如今，在稀里哗啦市也常常可以听见《跳蚤之歌》。

sentences.english: For a moment, I will be moved thinly in crash-bang.
sentences.chinese: 一瞬间，将我感动的稀里哗啦。

sentences.english: You were nearly crying your head off yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 你昨天都哭得稀里哗啦了。

definition: (onom.) sound of a crash/with a crash
to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life
tears and mucus flowing profusely/sniveling/in a tragic state
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
